thread.title: New Star Wars trailer for The Force Awakens gets three trailers of its own
thread.title_full: New Star Wars trailer for The Force Awakens gets three trailers of its own

author: Michael Idato
title: New Star Wars trailer for The Force Awakens gets three trailers of its own
text:
BB-8 aboard the Millennium Falcon in one of the Star Wars 'sneak peak' trailers. 
As if the media tsunami concerning the new Star Wars film was not already off the scale, the highly-anticipated new trailer for the film comes with not one but three trailers of its own.
Over the weekend Disney released three short 'sneak peek' trailers for the film's new trailer, which was due to be screened Monday night, US time, during a football game telecast.
The match, between the New York Giants and the Philadelphia Eagles, airs under the Monday Night Football banner on ESPN, a sports channel owned by Disney.
Daisy Ridley as Rey in the new Star Wars film, The Force Awakens. 
The three 'sneak peek' trailers are short, and feature a mix of familiar material and some different angles on scenes already teased in previous trailers.
Advertisement That should not diminish the appetite for the longer new trailer due Monday (Tuesday, Australian time.)
It is expected to contain glimpses of previously unseen scenes from the film. It is, in effect, a Molotov cocktail which Disney is throwing on an already raging bonfire of fan excitement about the new film.
Cloaked in darkness â€“Adam Driver as Kylo Ren in The Force Awakens. 
The Force Awakens will be the first new Star Wars film to be released since 2005's Revenge of the Sith , and the first new Star Wars film directly connected to the original trilogy since 1983's Return of the Jedi .
It will feature several of the original trilogy's cast, including Mark Hamill as Luke Skywalker, Harrison Ford as Han Solo and Carrie Fisher as Princess Leia.
The three 'sneak peeks' and the new teaser trailer also come with a newly released poster, featuring the original trilogy stars, and new characters Finn (John Boyega), Poe Dameron (Oscar Issac) and Rey (Daisy Ridley).
The poster also shows the film's new villains, Kylo Ren (Adam Driver) and Captain Phasma (Gwendolyn Christie), and a glimpse of a large Death Star-like space station, rumoured to be the Starkiller Base, the headquarters of the film's main post-Empire "faction", the First Order.
Star Wars: The Force Awakens will be released in cinemas on December 18.
